definition: to fool/to deceive/to go through the motions
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: We are playing the fool with ourselves because of careless reading.
sentences.chinese: 因为阅读不仔细，我们一味糊弄自己。

sentences.english: When you're a financial institution you can't fool around.It's all about confidence.
sentences.chinese: 一家金融机构不能糊弄人，这是事关信心的问题。

sentences.english: The amateur singer is reluctant to cheat the audience by lip-synching with a false display of affectation。
sentences.chinese: 这位业余歌手不愿意以虚情假意去假唱糊弄听众。

sentences.english: When you're a financial institution you can't fool around. It's all about confidence.
sentences.chinese: 一家金融机构不能糊弄人，这是事关信心的问题。

sentences.english: Alas, this turns out to be balls.
sentences.chinese: 唉，原来这一切都是糊弄人的。

sentences.english: Treasury Department must stop fudging and obfuscating.
sentences.chinese: 首先，美国财政部应该停止搪塞和糊弄。

sentences.english: Like puppies trapped in a cage in the window of a pet shop, they are addicted to the interest you show in them.
sentences.chinese: 男人就像宠物商店橱窗里的小狗狗一样，很好糊弄的。

sentences.english: You tease me because you think I’m a silly girl.
sentences.chinese: 你以为我是个傻妞就糊弄我。

sentences.english: Muddle avoids problems, it does not solve them.
sentences.chinese: 搪塞糊弄是避开了问题，却没有解决问题。

sentences.english: Who was this going to fool?
The mother would be much harder to fool.
sentences.chinese: 但母亲就不太好糊弄了。

sentences.english: You know, some people might be fooled by that innocent boyish exterior.
sentences.chinese: 你要知道，有些人会被你看似大男孩的单纯糊弄住。

definition: variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to fool/to deceive/to go through the motions
to muddle through/to fob sb off/to beat around the bush/to dodge
to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
pinyin: zheng1 zhe5 yan3 jing1 shuo1 xia1 hua4

definition: to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
